title: Malaysian Hot & Sour Sea Bass with Lemongrass Rice
keywords: Malaysian, Sea bass, Hot and sour, Lemongrass, Rice, Spicy, Fish

method.step: Bash your lemon grass with a rolling pin
Remove the tough layers of your lemongrass and set aside for later
Chop the softer core(s) finely
Add your basmati rice, outer lemongrass layers and your cold water to a pot with a lit and bring to the boil over a heigh heat
Once boiling reduce the heat to verry low and cook, covered for 10-12 minutes or until all the water has been absorbed and the rice is cooked.  This is your lemongrass rice
Score the skin off your sea bass fillet(s) 3 or 4 times on the diagonal (be careful not to slice all the way through)
Season both sides with a pinch of salt and pepper
Heat a large wide based pan with a drizzle of vegetable oil over a heigh heat
Once hot, add your sea bass fillet(s), skin side down and cook for 5 minutes, then flip the sea bass and cook for 1 minute further or until cooked though
Set aside and reserve the pan
Meanwhile, chop your tomato(es) into wedges
Return the reserved pan to a medium heigh hear with a drizzle of vegetable oil
Once hot, add the chopped lemongrass and tomato wedges to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes or until fragrant
Once fragrant add your sambal oelek, tamarind paste, ginger paste and your sugar with a splash of water
Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the vegetables are hot and tender but with a slight crunch
Chop your coriander finely, including the stalks
Serve your cooked sea bass with lemongrass rice to the side
Spoon your cooked sea bass with the lemongrass rice to the side
Garnish with the chopped coriander and your crispy onions
Enjoy
